column1: San Giovanni Valdarno is a town and comune in the province of Arezzo
column4: located in the valley of the Arno River.  It was originally called Castel S. Giovanni.

column1: According  to the Italian medieval historian Giovanni Villani
column2: the town was founded in 1296 by the Republic of Florence.  The design of the historic center is based on the organization of Roman cities with a large central piazza from which two main roads run perpendicular to each other.  From these two main roads run other secondary streets.

column1: The town is the birthplace of the early Renaissance painter Masaccio.
